text: The Great Gatsby, written by F. Scott Fitzgerald and published in 1925, is a novel set in the Jazz Age on Long Island. It is a classic of American literature, focusing on themes of wealth, love, and social status.

Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone is the first book in J.K. Rowling's acclaimed fantasy series. Released in 1997, it follows the story of a young wizard attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

Inception is a 2010 science fiction thriller directed by Christopher Nolan. The film explores the concept of shared dreaming, where a team of skilled thieves attempt to implant an idea into a target's subconscious.
Pride and Prejudice is an 1813 novel by Jane Austen that explores issues of love, social standing, and individualism in early 19th century England.
The Matrix, directed by the Wachowskis and released in 1999, is a groundbreaking science fiction action film exploring the nature of reality and artificial intelligence.
